subject: Re: [junit] Parameterisation of tests in JUnit4
msgSnippet: ... More importantly, it is a bad idea to use annotations to pass the data! Anotations should give the hints (tags, markers) how to get the data but not the
messageBody:
CÃ©dric Beust ? wrote:

>>> @Test
>>> @Parameters(strings={"hello", "there"})
>>> public void test3(String input)
>>> {
>>> assertEquals(input, input.toLowerCase());
>>> }
>>>
>>>
>>I like that a lot.
>>
>>
>The only problem with this approach is that you are very limited in the
>objects you can pass via annotations (only primitive types, and this
>approach won't work for methods that accept more than one parameter).
>
>
More importantly, it is a bad idea to use annotations to pass the
data! Anotations should give the hints (tags, markers) how to get the
data but not the data itself.

regards,
Eugene




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
